name: Event-viewer-js
body:
## Event-viewer-js
Porting [Event Viewer](http://mathieu.guillame-bert.com/software#EventViewer) to the web.

## Accessing the demo website
Step 1. forward port 8443 (Linux/Mac)

```ssh -L8443:compute-0-0.int.autonlab.org:8443 <your_auton_account>@lop1.autonlab.org```

Windows users can [download](PuTTY.exe from http://the.earth.li/~sgtatham/putty/latest/x86/putty.exe) and use PuTTY.
![putty](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9220766/9528020/87ba9ef8-4cc0-11e5-9e61-90fed21593d2.jpg)

Step 2. point your browser to [https://localhost:8443/owf](https://localhost:8443/owf), log in with the following credential
```
testUser2
password
```

Step 3. accept the browser security warning. This [article](http://www.inmotionhosting.com/support/website/ssl/self-signed-ssl-certificate-warning) describes steps for Firefox, IE and Chrome(recommended).

## Portal
**We use [Bitbucket](https://bitbucket.org/d8w/event-viewer-js) to host the project.**
Event-viewer-js on Bitbucket is a private repository, so you will need an authorized Bitbucket account to access its content.

* [File bugs and request features](https://bitbucket.org/d8w/event-viewer-js/issues?status=new&status=open)

## Browser compatibility
* Firefox
* Chrome
* IE 10+

## Layouts
You can access event-viewer-js in different layouts. Two predefined layouts are tab view and portal view. You can switch between them by clicking ```My Apps -> EventViewer or EventViewer Portal```. You can add your own layout by clicking ```Create New``` in ```My Apps``` dialog.

## Screenshots

![ev-tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9220766/9528186/4c50f29e-4cc1-11e5-995d-920ea562bedc.png)
